thread.title: Bluffton High School student arrested for shooting threat
thread.title_full: Bluffton High School student arrested for shooting threat | savannahnow.com

author: Bluffton Today
title: Bluffton High School student arrested for shooting threat
text:
Photos Tyler Dowling By Bluffton Today A Bluffton High School student was arrested Monday morning after telling other students he heard someone was going to "shoot up" the school, according to the Bluffton Police Department.
Tyler Dowling, 17, has been charged with disturbing a school after a school resource officer learned that he sent a group message to several students saying he head someone would shoot the school up, according to a police department news release.
Dowling told police he did send the message to friends, but was joking about the incident.
Anyone with further information about the incident can contact police investigator David Murphy at 843-706-4513. You may also remain anonymous by contacting the department's crime tip line at 843-706-4560.
